content: What ancient civilization built the iconic pyramids at Giza?

The ancient civilization that built the iconic pyramids at Giza was the Old Kingdom of Ancient Egypt, specifically during the period around 2580-2560 BC. The most famous among them are the Great Pyramids of Khufu, Khafre, and Menkaure. These monumental structures were built as tombs for the pharaohs and served as symbols of their power and importance in Egyptian society.
